description: Borrowed from French brigadier. Equivalent to brigade +â€Ž -ier.

entries.meaning: (military) An army rank; an officer commanding a brigade.
(military, UK) A field officer of the highest grade, below general officers, NATO grade O7.
(historical) The head of a workforce in the Soviet Union.
examples: The supervisory staff of the farm did their work well, according to the source. All the brigadiers were old, experienced workers who knew their business.
